civil war began in 1975 and ended in
1990 it was a war over the distribution
of power among it between different
sectarian groups in the country or
really more specifically the
distribution of power among the elites
of different sectarian groups the
principal axis of tension in the war was
between those who wanted to maintain the
older system of Maronite hegemony the
privileged Maronite Catholic elites and
those who wanted to make the political
system more representative of and
accountable to the population of the
entire country
so although it's often depicted as a
religious war or war over religion or
even a war between religious communities
or sects it really was a struggle over
the distribution of power
despite this fighting and displacement
of population did often blend into
tensions between different sectarian
communities and at times degenerated
into blind inter-communal violence on
top of killed and injured there were
thousands of kidnappings that took place
during the war the kidnappings were
often done on the basis of one's
communal or religious identity because
my beneath identity documents officially
list your religion if you're caught by

very often people would disappear and
that would be that nobody would know
what happens to them everybody knows

there's a big difference between killed

dis disappear you don't know what

there's no resolution for the trauma
